tips.title: Safety Tips
tips.practiceReminder: Remember: Practice these steps regularly so they become second nature during an emergency.
tips.introText: Learn essential earthquake safety techniques. Tap each tip to learn more about proper procedures.

drop.title: Drop
drop.description: Drop to your hands and knees immediately. This position protects you from being knocked over and allows you to stay low and crawl to shelter if nearby.
steps: Get down on your hands and knees
Be ready to move to cover

cover.title: Cover
cover.description: Take cover under a sturdy desk or table if available. If no shelter is nearby, cover your head and neck with your arms and hands.
steps: Get under a sturdy desk or table
If no shelter, protect your head and neck
Stay away from windows and heavy objects

holdOn.title: Hold On
holdOn.description: Hold on to your shelter and be prepared to move with it. If under a table, hold on with one hand and protect your head/neck with the other.
steps: Be prepared to move with it
Keep protecting your head and neck

emergencyKit.title: Emergency Kit
emergencyKit.description: Prepare an emergency kit with essential supplies that can last for at least 72 hours.
steps: Water: 1 gallon per person per day
